Title: Counterphobic attitude
Content: In psychology a counterphobic attitude is a response to anxiety that actively seeks it out in the hope of overcoming the original anxiousness. Codependents may fall into a subcategory of this group hiding their fears of attachment in overdependency. Daredevil activities are often undertaken in acounterphobic spirit as a denial of the fears attached to them. Sex is a key area for counterphobia activity sometimes powering hypersexuality in people who are actually afraid of the objects they believe they love.
